metadata.title: Comparison between CAD/CAM titanium mesh vs. conventional titanium mesh in bone regeneration: a systematic review and metaanalysis Gian Maria Ragucci1 , Antonio Fernández Augè1*, Anna Tresserra Parra1, Basel Elnayef1

introduction.first_sentence: Dental implant treatment has significantly evolved since its early stages, becoming a predictable and widely accepted technique [1].

introduction.last_sentence: The objective of this systematic review is to analyze the clinical and radiological outcomes—including vertical and horizontal bone gain—as well as the potential complications and challenges associated with the use of customized versus conventional t

discussion.heading: Discussion
discussion.first_sentence: In the current literature, there are still few studies that directly compare the outcomes of conventional titanium mesh (TM) and customized titanium mesh (CTM) in guided bone regeneration procedures.
discussion.first_100_chars: In the current literature, there are still few studies that directly compare the outcomes of convent
discussion.last_sentence: These findings may help guide clinicians in selecting the most appropriate technique for vertical ridge augmentation procedures.

conclusions.heading: Conclusions
conclusions.first_sentence: Within the limitations of this study, the use of customized titanium mesh (CTM) appears to be an effective technique for bone augmentation.

conclusions.last_sentence: To gain a clearer understanding of their potential impact, additional randomized controlled trials with extended follow-up periods are recommended.
